title: doc: improve rendering of example books
body: Decrease margins, set `hosted-html`, and configure fallback fonts for rendered example books

title: chore(deps): update `pulldown-cmark-to-cmark`, `toml`, and `regex` dependencies
body:
- Update `regex` version requirement to avoid [security advisory](https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2022-0013.html)
- Update `pulldown-cmark-to-cmark` to 13.0.0
- Update `toml` to 0.8

title: feat: hide/show hidden lines in Rust code blocks
body:
Hides [hidden lines in Rust code blocks](https://rust-lang.github.io/mdBook/format/mdbook.html?highlight=hidden#hiding-code-lines) and adds an option to configure this behavior.

Respects `[output.html.code.hidelines]` and per-code-block `hidelines=` attributes.

Closes #73

title: fix(CI): run `apt-get update` before installing packages
Upgrade `pulldown-cmark` to 0.10
fix: replace redirects that can't be resolved with links to hosted HTML
feat: link to hosted HTML version of book when relative links can't be resolved
body: Adds a `hosted-html` option to specify the URL of a hosted HTML version of the book. If set, relative links that can't be resolved within the book will be translated to links to the hosted version of the book.

title: chore: release v0.5.0
feat: wrap cells of wide tables
body: Emulates [Pandoc's cell-wrapping behavior for tables](https://pandoc.org/MANUAL.html#extension-pipe_tables) to prevent wide tables from overflowing the page

title: chore: update example book submodules
feat: wrap long lines in code blocks
body:
Uses the [`fvextra` package](https://mirror.mwt.me/ctan/macros/latex/contrib/fvextra/fvextra.pdf) to enable line wrapping in code blocks in LaTeX books.

TODO:
- [x] ~Really long lines result in errors (see rustc-dev-guide, https://github.com/Wandmalfarbe/pandoc-latex-template/issues/122#issuecomment-538011690)~
    Resolved by wrapping really long lines in `\texttt{}`
- [x] ~Wrap long lines in code blocks with no language infostring (i.e., ```)~
    Resolved by replacing empty infostrings with "text"

title: fix: don't nest suffix chapters under most recent book part in PDF bookmarks
fix: correctly number chapters
body: Fixes chapter numbering in the presence of prefix/suffix chapters and multiple top-level headings per chapter

title: fix: correctly check mdBook version compatibility
body: Previously, if `mdbook-pandoc` was compiled against `mdbook` 0.4.36, it would report `mdbook` 0.4.35 as semver-incompatible. This allows using older patch versions as well as newer compatible versions (i.e., ^0.4 instead of ^0.4.36)

Changelog

--- This PR was generated with [release-plz](https://github.com/MarcoIeni/release-plz/).

title: Support lists nested more than four levels deep when rendering to LaTeX
body: LaTeX by default can't handle lists with more than four levels of items. If necessary to render the book, this adds a dependency on the `enumitem` package to support more nested lists.

title: Document that Pandoc is run from the book's root directory
Support older versions of Pandoc (with possibly degraded output)
body:
Supports older versions of Pandoc by selectively enabling extensions based on the Pandoc version. The preprocessor will avoid adding dependencies on unavailable extensions but there are no fallback mechanisms, so this will likely result in degraded output with older versions of Pandoc.

- [x] Take available extensions into account while preprocessing source
- [x] Only emit warnings about unavailable extensions that are actually needed

Closes #35

title: Run `pandoc` with mdBook root as working directory
body: Sets the working directory for `pandoc` to the mdBook root directory instead of the destination directory, which makes more sense when passing filenames to Pandoc through options like [`--include-in-header`](https://pandoc.org/MANUAL.html#option--include-in-header).

title: Update `cargo-dist` to v0.6.0
Download remote images that pandoc doesn't handle on its own
body:
Closes #18

> Pandoc currently doesn't support using URLs with paths that do not have standard image extensions (e.g. `.png`, `.svg`) as image destinations.
>
> For example, pandoc will not process the following GitHub actions badge from [shields.io](https://shields.io):
> ```md 
> ![Build](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/ci.yml?style=flat-square) 
> ```

This implements a heuristic fix to download images that pandoc is known not to support.

title: Decrease log level of ignored separator warning to DEBUG
body: Separators (see [here](https://rust-lang.github.io/mdBook/format/summary.html#structure)) are used only to render lines dividing the table of contents. We may want to do something with them in the future, but ignoring them isn't particularly important to report

title: Allow configuring logging with `RUST_LOG` environment variable
body: Configures `env_logger` to parse the `RUST_LOG` environment variable to [determine which logs to emit](https://docs.rs/env_logger/latest/env_logger/#enabling-logging).

title: Support redirects listed in `[output.html.redirect]`
body: Supports redirecting links with [`[output.html.redirect]`](https://rust-lang.github.io/mdBook/format/configuration/renderers.html#outputhtmlredirect)

title: Document known issue with images located at URLs that have `.yml` path extensions
Syntax highlighting for Rust code blocks with mdBook attributes
body: Strips [mdBook attributes](https://rust-lang.github.io/mdBook/format/mdbook.html#rust-code-block-attributes) from Rust code blocks so they are interpreted as Rust code blocks by pandoc.

title: chore: release v0.1.3
body:
## 🤖 New release * `mdbook-pandoc`: 0.1.2 -> 0.1.3
Changelog

## [0.1.3] - 2023-12-05 ### Bug Fixes - Correctly identify profiles as LaTeX when output file is PDF and no PDF engine or output format is specified ([#14](https://github.com/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/pull/14)) - Syntax highlighting for Rust code blocks with mdBook attributes ([#16](https://github.com/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/pull/16)) ### Documentation - Document known issue with images located at URLs that have `.yml` path extensions ([#17](https://github.com/max-heller/mdbook-pandoc/pull/17))

--- This PR was generated with [release-plz](https://github.com/MarcoIeni/release-plz/).

title: Correctly identify profiles as LaTeX when output file is PDF and no PDF engine or output format is specified
body: When no PDF engine or output format is specified, pandoc [defaults to using LaTeX to create PDFs](https://pandoc.org/MANUAL.html#creating-a-pdf).

title: Fix release workflow
body: The `rust-cache` action in the release workflow currently breaks because this repo's submodules contain a lot of `Cargo.toml` and `Cargo.lock` files. This will be fixed by https://github.com/Swatinem/rust-cache/pull/180, but for now this PR disables cloning submodules during the release workflow.

title: Update `cargo-dist`
body: Updates `cargo-dist` from v0.4.3->v0.5.0 and enable building shell and powershell installers

title: Eliminate redundant processing of tags during start and end events
body: `pulldown-cmark` emits paired start and end events for each tag. Previously, we would process each tag twice--once for each event. Now, we stash a copy of the processed tag in a stack and use the last tag in the stack as the tag for each end event.

title: chore: explicitly include files for cargo packaging
body: Prevents `cargo package` from including unnecessary files, in particular the `books` subdirectory

title: ci: run clippy workflow on Windows and MacOS in addition to Ubuntu
fix: escape quotes within link titles
body:
Before, link titles that contained quotes would be rendered without their interior quotes escaped and preprocessing would turn
```md
[link](dest "\"weird title\"")
```
into
```md
[link](dest ""weird title"")
```
resulting in a broken link.

This was due to a bug in `pulldown-cmark-to-cmark` fixed in https://github.com/Byron/pulldown-cmark-to-cmark/pull/62 and released in version 11.0.2, so this PR bumps the version requirement.

ci: run normal workflows on release PRs
body: See https://release-plz.ieni.dev/docs/github/trigger
